Dear Sheffield City Council,
I am writing to you under the Freedom of Information Act 2000 to request the following information:
1. The current number of your employees who are fully remote, i.e., they have no expectation at all to attend work in person.
2. The current number of your employees who are partially remote, i.e., they work in a hybrid model with one or a few days a week in the office.
3. Any recruitment targets or policies you have in place that determine the number of future workers that will work remotely.
4. The total number of employees currently employed by your organisation.
Please provide this information electronically, preferably in a format that allows for data to be manipulated (Excel or CSV file), if possible.
Yours faithfully,
Laura Riley

Dear Laura Riley,
Thank you for your request for information relating to remote working
which we received on 22/06/2023.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
1. The current number of your employees who are fully remote, i.e., they
have no expectation at all to attend work in person. We don’t hold
information on the number of employees working from home.
2. The current number of your employees who are partially remote, i.e.,
they work in a hybrid model with one or a few days a week in the office.
We don’t hold information on the number of employees working from home.
3. Any recruitment targets or policies you have in place that determine
the number of future workers that will work remotely. No targets or
policies in place.
4. The total number of employees currently employed by your organisation.
8402.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [1]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[2]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council

Sheffield, S1 1UJ
